Nightmares are Slayer monsters that are created from Mah's Nightmares during Children of Mah. They require level 80 Slayer to be harmed. The ability to have them assigned as slayer tasks by Kuradal, Morvran, and Laniakea can be purchased using 50 slayer points after Children of Mah.

Nightmares can be found at the Freneskae Ritual Site after the quest. The ritual site teleport can be found while using the World Gate to travel to Freneskae.

v • d • e
Freneskae ritual site

  • Cave entrance to leave to Freneskae

Mechanics[edit | edit source]

Nightmares attack with melee. The melee attack is not particularly powerful and can easily be countered by Soul Split. Nightmares are capable of running, and they will often force the player out of the tile they are standing on due to this.

After every five auto-attacks, the Nightmare will use a ranged attack that can deal up to around 5,000 damage in two simultaneous hits. This attack has a long start up animation that is signalled by the Nightmare creating a black sphere in their hands, taking a step back, then tossing it at the player. It takes a total of three seconds before the damage is dealt onto the player. The ranged damage can be reduced by 75% with Protect/Deflect Missiles. Stunning the Nightmare during the animation will not stop or delay the attack, because the Nightmare will stun itself to prevent itself from moving during the animation. This special attack deals no damage if the Nightmare dies during the special attack animation.

Luck-enhancing items are not required to access the table, but they will increase the chance of accessing the rare drop table and may also improve the loot received from it.

    Update history[edit | edit source]

    This information has been compiled as part of the update history project. Some updates may not be included – see here for how to help out!
    • patch 9 September 2019 (Update):
      • Players can no longer stand near the north-eastern pillar to negate any damage received when fighting Nightmares.
    • patch 19 August 2019 (Update):
      • A safe spot when fighting Nightmare creatures has been removed.
    • patch 8 April 2019 (Update):
      • The special attack from nightmare creatures will no longer deal damage after the NPC has died.
    • patch 6 February 2017 (Update):
      • Nightmare creatures are now less likely to want to run away from you.
    • patch 16 January 2017 (Update):
      • Nightmare creatures will now drop gloves substantially less frequently when not the subject of the player’s current slayer assignment.
    • patch 28 November 2016 (Update):
      • The cave at the bottom of the lava falls now correctly leads to nightmare creatures when re-visiting Freneskae.
    • hotfix 22 November 2016 (Update):
      • Players no longer get hit by the nightmare creature shadow attack if the creature is dying.
    • hotfix 21 November 2016 (Update):
      • Players will no longer receive nightmare creature slayer tasks from Kuradal without completing Children of Mah.
      • Players will no longer receive nightmare creature slayer tasks without unlocking the ability to receive the task.
    • update 21 November 2016 (Update):
      • Added to game.

    Trivia[edit | edit source]

    • As of 1 February 2018, the highest kill count for this monster was 14,182 kills.[2]
      • This had increased to 14,302 by 6 May 2018.[3]
    • The Nightmares are similar to the Muspah as they were, as their name suggests, dreamt into being by the Elder God Mah through one of her Nightmares, and share a similar drop table, including muspah spines.
    • Despite being divine creations, they drop bones, whereas the muspah and nihil don't.
